getPrologInterface

public PrologInterface getPrologInterface()
retrieve the PrologInterface that created this session.

query

public java.util.Map query(java.lang.String query)
                    throws PrologException,
                           PrologInterfaceException
Deprecated. use queryAll or queryOnce instead

begins a query on the Prolog system. If there was an active query running, further results lost, so calls to next() will return results of this query. The resultant Hashtable contains keys equal to the unbound variables in the query, and values equal to their binding. If null is returned, no bindings could satisfy the query ("no"). If there were no unbound variables, an empty Hashtable is returned to signify "yes".

please note:

It seems that interactive queries imply quiet a deal of extra complexity in all the implementations i tried so far. They are also significantly slower due to the added "synchronisation points" and the resulting io overhead. At the moment i cannot think of any scenario that would require the interactive concept anyway, so i would like to get rid of it asap.

Parameters:
query - a prolog query
Returns:
a hashtable, containing the bindings generated.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalStateException - the session is disposed
PrologException - an abnormal condition was detected
PrologInterfaceException

next

public java.util.Map next()
                   throws PrologException,
                          PrologInterfaceException
Deprecated. use queryAll or queryOnce instead

returns the next set of Bindings satisfying the last query. please note:

It seems that interactive queries imply quiet a deal of extra complexity in all the implementations i tried so far. They are also significantly slower due to the added "synchronisation points" and the resulting io overhead. At the moment i cannot think of any scenario that would require the interactive concept anyway, so i would like to get rid of it asap.

Returns:
another set of Bindings
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalStateException - the session is disposed
PrologException - an IO Error occured .
PrologInterfaceException

endQuery

public void endQuery()
              throws PrologException,
                     PrologInterfaceException
Deprecated. use queryAll or queryOnce instead

explicitly ends the last query, discarding further results if any existed. If no query was active, this is a noop. please note:

It seems that interactive queries imply quiet a deal of extra complexity in all the implementations i tried so far. They are also significantly slower due to the added "synchronisation points" and the resulting io overhead. At the moment i cannot think of any scenario that would require the interactive concept anyway, so i would like to get rid of it asap.

Throws:
java.lang.IllegalStateException - the session is disposed
PrologException - a lower-level failure has occured while killing the query.
PrologInterfaceException
